info.name: HubSpot
info.description:
This postman collection contains templates for Data APIs for your vault.To use this collection:

* Obtain an API bearer token and paste it into the *Variables* tab as the current value of the *bearer token* variable.If you are using try.skyflow.com, you can obtain an API bearer token from the Studio UI as described in Getting Started Guide.

* Fill in the requested parameters for each API



And that's it! If you get stuck, you can always refer to the Data API docs here: [https://docs.skyflow.com/api/record](https://docs.skyflow.com/api/record)

item.name: Returns Audit Events based on the query parameters

request.name: Returns Audit Events based on the query parameters

description.content: Based on the request query parameters, the api returns a list of audit events which meets the criteria. [https://docs.skyflow.com/api/management#tag/Audit](https://docs.skyflow.com/api/management#tag/Audit)

query.description: Unique ID for Audit Event.
Internal autogenerated Request ID unique for each request.
Trace ID of the request made by client.
Session ID as part of which the user is executing queries.
Actor for the request. Based on actortype, Format for the actor could be - userID or emailID or serviceAccountID

ActorType for the request. It could be USER or SERVICE_ACCOUNT

 - NONE: NONE is undefined and should not be used.
 - USER: Indicates the Member is of type User.
 - GROUP: Indicates the Member is of type Group.
 - SERVICE_ACCOUNT: Indicates the Member is of type ServiceAccount.
 - SQL_SERVICE_ACCOUNT: Indicates the Member is of SqlServiceAccount.
The access type of the request. The access type could be (API, SQL etc.)
IP Address of the client from which the request is being made.
The parent accountID of the resource.
(Required) The accountID of the resource.
The workspaceID of the resource.
The vaultID of the resource.

Resources associated with the request (Comma Separated). This is to provide better search capabilities. (Comma Separated). Could be group resource and user resource ids and types. Key will be of the form 'vault/id', 'user/id', etc. Any single Resource matches, the result will be returned
The audit action type (INSERT, UPDATE, etc).
The resource method name. The Resource method names as in api docs

Tags associated with Event if any (Comma Separated). This is to provide better search capabilities (Comma Separated). Where Keys could be login, get, dml, etc. Any single Tag matches, the result will be returned
The https response code for the operation.
The start timestamp for the query.
The end timestamp for the query.
api name (grpc service name).
response or error message, like SUCCESS etc....
http method like GET, POST etc....
http URI like /v1/vaults/{vaultID}/{tablename}/{ID}.
Fully qualified Object field by which to sort results. Field names should be passed in camel case (e.g. camelCase).
Either ascending or descending order specification.
The timestamp provided in previous response's nextOps attribute. Cannot be clubbed with sortOps or offset. For first time call, leave blank..
The changeID provided in previous response's nextOps attribute. Cannot be clubbed with sortOps or offset. For first time call, leave blank..
Pagination Limit.  - indicates the number of records to retrieve.
Pagination Offset. - indicates the record number to start retrieving data.

description.content: Executes specified Record CRUD APIs in a single transaction. [https://docs.skyflow.com/api/record/#operation/RecordService_BatchOperation](https://docs.skyflow.com/api/record/#operation/RecordService_BatchOperation)

Deletes all records or records matching the provided skyflow_id(s). [https://docs.skyflow.com/api/record/#operation/RecordService_BulkDeleteRecord](https://docs.skyflow.com/api/record/#operation/RecordService_BulkDeleteRecord)

Gets records matching the provided skyflow_id(s). [https://docs.skyflow.com/api/record/#operation/RecordService_BulkGetRecord](https://docs.skyflow.com/api/record/#operation/RecordService_BulkGetRecord)

query.description: List of skyflow_id(s) of the records to be retrieved. If not present, all records will be retrieved.
Redaction level to enforce on the record (subject to Policies assigned to the caller of this API).
If true, tokens are included in the response.
Subset of fields to be retrieved for the given record. If not specified, all fields will be retrieved.
Record position at which to start retrieving data.
Number of records to retrieve.
If true, file download URLs are returned for fields that are of blob data type.

description.content: Inserts a record in the specified table. [https://docs.skyflow.com/api/record/#operation/RecordService_InsertRecord](https://docs.skyflow.com/api/record/#operation/RecordService_InsertRecord)

Deletes the specified record. The skyflow_id of the deleted record is returned if successful. [https://docs.skyflow.com/api/record/#operation/RecordService_DeleteRecord](https://docs.skyflow.com/api/record/#operation/RecordService_DeleteRecord)

query.description: Decides if projection populated should be Sync or Not (No Eventual consistency).

variable.description: (Required) skyflow_id of the record to be retrieved.

description.content: Retrieves the specified record. The entire row is returned unless a subset of fields is specified. [https://docs.skyflow.com/api/record/#operation/RecordService_GetRecord](https://docs.skyflow.com/api/record/#operation/RecordService_GetRecord)

query.description: Redaction level to enforce on the record (subject to Policies assigned to the caller of this API).
If true, tokens are included in the response.
Subset of fields to be retrieved for the given record. If not specified, all fields will be retrieved.
If true, file download URLs are returned for fields that are of blob data type.

variable.description: (Required) skyflow_id of the record to be retrieved.
(Required) ID of the record to be updated.

description.content: Retrieves records for the query provided.

Retrieves the record corresponding to the provided token. [https://docs.skyflow.com/api/record#operation/RecordService_Detokenize](https://docs.skyflow.com/api/record#operation/RecordService_Detokenize)

Returns the tokens associated with the records passed. Only applicable for deterministically tokenized fields. [https://docs.skyflow.com/api/record#operation/RecordService_Tokenize](https://docs.skyflow.com/api/record#operation/RecordService_Tokenize)
